alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oldham; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Oldham, northwestern Shelby and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jeffersontown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Anchorage and Woodland Hills around 515 PM EDT. Middletown and Worthington Hills around 520 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
